newsitem.title: INDIA: India approves mineral prospecting proposals.
newsitem.headline: India approves mineral prospecting proposals.

text.p: India's Mines Ministry said on Friday it had approved five proposals for mineral prospecting in the country by foreign companies.

The ministry said in a statement four approvals had been given to BHP Mineral India (P) Ltd, a wholly-owned subsidiary of of BHP Minerals of Australia, to conduct aerial prospecting in northern Rajasthan state for copper, lead, zinc, gold and silver.
The total area covered under this would be about 8,379.20 sq km (3,234 sq miles), the statement said.

It said approval was also given to CRA Exploration India (P) Ltd to prospect for copper, lead, zinc, gold and silver in an area covering 1,916 sq km area in Ajmer and Kishenganj districts of Rajasthan.
CRA is supported by RTZ-CRA, an international exploration and mining firm.

The approvals are a sequel to government's policy guidelines issued last year to grant large areas for prospecting licences and speed up investments in the minerals sector. --New Delhi newsroom +91-11 301 2024
